title: Fraktur again: an international affair
content:
Accidentally I came across these two enchanting examples of blackletter typography \*out\* of the Latin sphere. Anything the like known of other scripts?  
(apologies for the limited image quality)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131083051im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Georgischfraktur_2_6672.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131083051im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Chatzi_3701.jpg)
author: Andreas St√∂tzner

comments.content:
Oh, wow. That Georgian is crazy :-)  
(I wonder how legible it is?)

Armenian, from Yerevan:  
(And all caps no less!)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131083051im_/http:/typophile.com/files/armenian-blackletter_6443.jpg)
The second image is in Greek...has a bit of a Byzantine quality to it.
